title: Class 2A No. 1 Dale boys rout No. 6 Vanoss 83-41
description: VANOSS – The Class 2A top-ranked Dale Pirates connected on eleven 3-point shot attempts in rolling to am 83-41 rout of sixth-ranked and host Vanoss on Friday. Denton Forsythe, who sank five of those treys, finished with 27 points.

title: Cone plans load management on Brownlee in Doha
creator: Richard Dy
description: MANILA, Philippines — Following a grueling three-game quarterfinal series, Tim Cone's coaching job won't have any down time at all as his mind now switches to a new level when he handles the Gilas Pilipinas side that will be playing three games in a friendly tournament this week in Doha, Qatar.Ginebra worked doubly hard on Sunday before scraping past Meralco, 94-87 in a a highly-emotional sudden death Game 3 to win their PBA Season 49 Commissioner's Cup quarterfinal series.The victory allowed the league's most popular squad to advance to the best-of-seven semifinal series where Cone's team faces top seed NorthPort two weeks from now.Cone admitted that three-time Best Import Justin Brownlee will be on "load management" come the three games in Doha as they try to keep his legs fresh for the two coming away Games against Taiwan and New Zealand in the last window of the FIBA Asia Cup 2025 Qualifiers."It's gonna be tough. He's going to doha, and playing those games in between," Cone told media men Sunday night, referring to Brownlee, who delivered 25 points, 10 rebounds and seven assists in the series-clinching win for Ginebra."That will keep him sharp but we have to make sure not to overuse him, so we're really planning for load management with Justin," added the 67-year-old Gilas and Ginebra coach.Similarly, the American coach said they intend to put Fil-Cypriot big man AJ Edu and eight-time PBA Most Valuable Player June Mar Fajardo under load management, too, knowing they have two tough FIBA games coming up."People may be wondering why they aren't at the floor all the time (once Gilas plays in Doha) but we plan to keep them fresh all the time going to New Zealand and Taiwan," he said.Still, Cone expects the 36-year-old Brownlee to play with all his heart for the national team, something he has done magnificently in the last two years he has donned the Philippine team jersey."He plays with his heart. It's a pride thing for him," shared Cone. "In the PBA, he plays for his livelihood, and this is where he makes his livelihood in the PBA. He doesn't make near the money in the national team than he does in the PBASo you can be sure he's playing hard when he goes back against NorthPort."Meanwhile, Brownlee said he looks forward to reconnecting with his Gilas teammates this week."I'm really looking froward to the trip. We haven't seen each other for couple months, so we just keep building chemistry and keep getting better," said Brownlee, who has helped Gilas to a 4-0 record in the first two windows to secure a spot in the FIBA Asia Cup set this August in Saudi Arabia.The Doha friendly tournament will feature host nation Qatar, Egypt, Lebanon and the Philippines from February 14-16.After the brief Doha sojourn, the Philippine team returns to Manila, before moving over to Taiwan and shortly, thereafter, Auckland in New Zealand for the final window of the Qualifiers.Gilas faces Taiwan on February 20, followed by New Zealand on Feb. 23 in two away games.The Philippines eyes to close the final window with victories.Gilas showed no mercy against Taiwan, smashing the foreign squad, 106-53 during the February 2024 window at the Mall of Asia Arena.And just last November, Gilas pulled the rug from under New Zealand, 93-89, marking the first time the Philippines defeated the former Oceanian basketball powerhouse since 2016.Young big man Kai Sotto, who stepped up big in the November window, won't be available this month since undergoing a knee surgery after tearing his ACL (anterior cruciate ligament) last December in a Japan B.League game.
